Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc03.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameControllerInterface, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class GameController extends Object implements GameControllerInterface, Runnable, Serializable
This class controls the gameplay flow of a match, from start to finish.

    • addPlayerToGame

      public void addPlayerToGame(String playerNickname, GameListener listener) throws CannotJoinGameException, DeskIsFullException, PlayerAlreadyJoinedException, RemoteException
      Method for adding a player to the game.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - The player's nickname.
      listener - The game listener for the player.
      Throws:
      CannotJoinGameException - This exception is thrown when the game has already started, is paused, or has ended, thus preventing the addition of new players.
      DeskIsFullException - This exception prevents additional players from being added when the game has already reached the maximum number of players allowed.
      PlayerAlreadyJoinedException - This exception is thrown to prevent duplicate addition of a player in the same game.
      RemoteException - This exception is thrown when there is an issue with remote communication.

    • placeStarterOnCodex

      public void placeStarterOnCodex(Player player, Side side) throws Exception
      The method handles the placing of the starter card on the Codex of the given player at the beginning of the game. This method ensures that the game is in the correct phase and the player is eligible to place the starter card. It also updates the game state and player's action based on the completion of this initial move.
      Specified by:
      placeStarterOnCodex in interface GameControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is placing the starter card. This player should be currently set to FIRSTMOVES action.
      side - The side of the starter card to be placed into the Codex.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the game is not in the STARTING phase or if the player has already placed their starter card.

    • selectCardObjective

      public void selectCardObjective(Player player, int cardObjective) throws Exception
      The method handles the selection of a personal objective card for a player at the start of the game. This method is called during the game's starting phase where players choose their personal objective cards. It ensures that the player is in the correct state to make a selection and updates the game state accordingly. If the player successfully selects a card and all players have finished their initial moves, the game transitions to the RUNNING state.
      Specified by:
      selectCardObjective in interface GameControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is selecting the objective card. The player must be in the FIRSTMOVES state.
      cardObjective - The index of the card in the player's list of objective cards that the player wishes to select.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the game is not in the STARTING phase, or if the player has already made their selection or if the player's current action is not set to DRAW.

    • checkFinalAction

      private void checkFinalAction(Player player)
      The method checks and updates the action of the given player based on the current game status. If the game is in the ENDING state, it sets the player's action to ENDED and checks if all players have ended their actions. If all players have finished their actions, it declares the game ended and determines the winner. If the game is not in the ENDING state, it sets the player's action to WAIT.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose action is to be updated based on the game's state.

    • drawCardFromDeck

      public void drawCardFromDeck(Player player, DeckType deck) throws Exception
      Allows a player to draw a card from a specified deck if the player's action is set to DRAW and the game is in the RUNNING or ENDING state. After drawing a card, the method updates the game and player states accordingly, setting the next action for the current player to PLACE.
      Specified by:
      drawCardFromDeck in interface GameControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is drawing the card. This player must have their action set to DRAW.
      deck - The deck from which the card is drawn.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the player's current action is not DRAW or if the game state is not suitable for drawing a card.

    • drawCardDisplayed

      public void drawCardDisplayed(Player player, DeckType deck, int index) throws RemoteException
      Allows a player to draw a specific card from a displayed deck, given the player's action is set to DRAW and the game is either in the RUNNING or ENDING state. This method ensures that the player draws the specified card and updates the game and player states accordingly. The action of the current player is then set to PLACE, preparing for the next phase of the game.
      Specified by:
      drawCardDisplayed in interface GameControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is drawing the card.
      deck - The displayed deck from which the card is drawn.
      index - The index of the card in the displayed deck that the player wishes to draw.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is an issue with remote communication.

    • placeCardOnCodex

      public void placeCardOnCodex(Player player, int index, boolean frontCard, int row, int col) throws Exception
      Places a card from the player's hand onto a specified position in their Codex. This action is permitted only when the game's status is either RUNNING or ENDING, and the player's current action must be PLACE. The method validates the game state and player's action, retrieves the specified side of the card, and attempts to place it in the Codex. If the placement is successful, the player's current state is updated and the card is removed from their hand. If the player's score reaches or exceeds a defined ENDING_SCORE after placing the card, the game status is set to ENDING.
      Specified by:
      placeCardOnCodex in interface GameControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is placing the card.
      index - The index of the card in the player's hand to be placed.
      frontCard - A boolean indicating whether to place the front (true) or back (false) side of the card.
      row - The row in the Codex where the card is to be placed.
      col - The column in the Codex where the card is to be placed.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the game's status is not RUNNING or ENDING, if the player's action is not PLACE, or if there is an error in placing the card in the Codex.

    • run

      public void run()
      The main game loop that handles different game statuses and manages online player interactions. This method runs continuously until the thread is interrupted. It checks the game status and adjusts the game flow accordingly, handling player connectivity and game state transitions.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the game deletion process, encapsulating the original NoSuchGameException.
